div1.head: Preface
div1.ab:
PREFACE
THE SHIMBUN RENGO-SHA, BY FAR THE MOST POWERFUL NEWS AGENCY* IN JAPAN, UNDERTAKING TO BE THE CENTRAL SYSTEM FOR THE SUPPLY OF NEWS AND NEWS-PHOTOS DEMANDED BY NEWSPAPERS ALL OVER THE WORLD, IN THE FIELDS OF POLITICS,. ECONOMICS, ‘FINANCE, HUMAN ‘INTEREST, SPORTS, THE STAGE AND ‘SCREEN, AND WHAT NOT; HAS PROVED ITSELF TO. CONSTITUTE THE MOST EFFICIENT EYE AND EAR OF THE EMPIRE OF JAPAN. WHAT WE GATHER AND DISTRIBUTE, FOREIGN NEWS AND NEWS-PHOTO, FROM OUR ASSOCIATES AND SPECIAL CORRESPONDENTS ABROAD, HOME NEWS FROM ALL POINTS IN JAPAN, PERIODICAL PUBLICATIONS OF FINANCIAL, SCIENTIFIC AND LITERARY INTEREST, ARE ALL VEHICLES FOR THE PROMOTION OF KNOWLEDGE AND CUL- TURE: THE ‘STUFF WE :>$ SUPPLY: IS DISPLAYED PROMINENTLY NOT ONLY IN JOURNALS AND MAGAZINES AT HOME BUT-ALSO IN SIMILAR PUBLICATIONS ALL OVER THE WORLD:
THE PHOTO SERVICE ESPECIALLY IS ONE OF OUR STRONG POINTS, AND WE NOTE THAT A LARGE NUMBER OF PHOTOGRAPHS SUPPLIED BY US ARE CARRIED BY DIVERSE PUBLICATIONS HOME AND ABROAD WITH OR WITHOUT THE CREDIT. " RENGO".
THE HISTORY IN THE MAKING, SO TO SPEAK, 1S CONTAINED IN THE PAGES OF THE DAILY NEWSPAPERS, BUT IT DOES NOT NEED ANY STRETCH OF IMAGINA- TION TO SEE HOW MUCH THE HISTORICAL VALUE OF SUCH RECORDS WILL: BE ENHANCED WITH THE ADDITION OF NEWS-PHOTOS WHICH AT A GLANCE GIVE THE WHOLE IDEA OF THE THINGS THAT HAVE HAPPENED. THIS IS THE VERY WORK WHICH WE HAVE PROPOSED TO UNDERTAKE, AND HERE WE OFFER TO THE PUBLIC THE FRUIT OF LABORIOUS WORK IN THAT DIRECTION.
NEEDLESS TO SAY,. THIS SIGNIFICANT WORK OF COLLECTING EXHAUSTIVELY NEWS-PHOTOS FROM ALL PARTS OF, JAPAN, SUPPLEMENTED WITH A COLLEC- TION OF ARTISTIC PHOTOS TAKEN BY CAMERAMEN OF OUR ASSOCIATED NEWS- PAPERS, HAS BEEN MADE POSSIBLE: THROUGH THE HEARTY COOPERATION OF OUR FRIENDS IN VARIQUS FIELDS.
WE HAVE. TAKEN THE TROUBLE OF PREPARING CAPTIONS IN ENGLISH WHICH WE HOPE WILL BE FOUND TO BE A VALUABLE ADDITION.
THIS: NEWS-PHOTO YEAR-BOOK , WILL BE A PRICELESS HiSTORICAL DOCU: MENT AS A SOCIOLOGICAL HISTORY! OF, JAPAN AT A GLANCE, GIVING YOU THE IDEA OF THE CHANGES THAT ARE TAKING PLACE IN JAPAN, ESPECIALLY AS THIS WILL BE PULBISHED ANNUALLY TO FOLLOW THE PROGRESS OF EVENTS.
BEFORE CONCLUDING THIS BRIEF PREFACE, THE EDITORS WISH TO OFFER THEIR PROFOUND THANKS TO THOSE WHO HAVE ASSISTED THEM AND HOPE THAT THEY AND MANY OTHERS WILL KINDLY COOPERATE WITH US IN THE FUTURE IN THE PREPARATION OF NEW ANNUAL EDITIONS OF THIS PUBLICATION.
THE SHIMBUN RENGO-SHA PHOTO DEPARTMENT.

Big Figures in Medical World of Far East Arrive.
Leading medical savants of Manchukuo, China, India etc. here to attend the 9th Japan Medical Congress were guests at a banquet on April 2 of Mr. Kinya Nagao, originator of the ‘“ Heafe” remedy (yeast treatment), head of the ‘“ Wakamoto ” Sales Company and President of the Nutrition and Nursing Society. Among those present were Dr. Tatsukichi Irizawa, chairman of the Japan Medical Congress, Dr. Mataro Nagayo, vice-chairman, and Dr. Yoneji Miyagawa, director of the institute of Infectious Diseases. The affair was a success. The photo- graph shows the distinguished company in the garden of Mr. Nagao.

Women Divers and wooden rafts from which oyster cages are hung down for 6 years to get pearls, at Mikimoto pearl farm.
We are cultivating more than 10,000,000 Ppearl-oyster, from baby pearl-oysters to the grown up Ppearl-oysters. After the pearl-oysters fas been cultivated for three years, a slight operation is performed on. it.
About one hundred pearl-oysters are cultivated in a wire basket which is called a culture cage. Several times a year the pearl-oysters in these cages are hauled up from sea so that seaweeds and barnacles, which fasten themselves to the oystershells and thereby hinder their development, may be scrapped off.
Today Twelve Mikimoto Pearl Cultivating Farmes are located in different parts of Japan, Gokasho Bay. Miye Prefecture, which is the center of the Mikimoto Pearl Industry, and Palau Island, in the South Seas. The entire area covers 40,830 acres, where 5,000,000 pearl-oysters are cultivated each year

By Mr. Kenzo Ikeda, Kokumin Shimbun-Sha.
The Shirokiya Department Store, since the completion of the building after the disastrous fire of 1932, is mak ng every effort to serve customers.
In carrying out this policy, not only to fill the needs of Japanese but foreign patrons as well, we have established the Souvenir Department and newly oaganized the Information Burea to afford the occidental community and visitors from oversea better means to make themselves familiar with things Japanese.
The Souvenir Department was organized two years ago at the suggestion of the Board of Tourist Industry. Here you can purchase Japanese articles suitable as souvenir to take home.
The Shirokiya Department Store realizing the growing desire of the foreign residents and visitors from abroad to become familiar with the arts and crafts of Japan, has founded the In- formation Bureau on the fifth floor in order to answer inquiries regarding commerce, art, science the theater, excursions etc. Inquiries by letter will also be answered in full detail.

Yanagawara Hydro-Electric Power Station. This is located in the lower reaches of the Kurobe River from which the Nippon Denryoku Kabushiki Kaisha gets its supply of electric power. With the capacity of 50700 kilo-watts, it is equipped for supply of power to the two major industrial areas around Tokyo in the east and Osaka in the west, playing an important part in the industrial activities of the Empire. A power transmission line, 154,000 volts extends over the distance of 220 miles to Osaka and 180 miles to Tokyo districts. Yana- gawara is situated at a distance of 12 miles from the Mikkaichi Station on the Hokuriku railway line. whereof 10.7 miles travelled by the Kurobe Railway and 1.3 miles by the Company’s own railway line. The valley above this power station offers attractive scenic beauties,

div1.head: [Acknowledgments?]
div1.ab:
Shimbun Rengo Sha, better known simply as ** Rengo”’, is an association of the leading new- papers of Japan, including the ten biggest journals of Tokyo and Osaka, for the purpose of gathering and distributing both news and news-photos to member newspapers and individual subscribers on a non-profit basis.
““Rengo ”’ has contracts with foreign news agencies and news-photo services all over the world for the
exchange of news and pictures, these being distributed in Japan promptly upon receipt.
【? 1 77% aes 2 9 を ・ ° ne G pea ・ select! ® Rengo’”’’s foreign news cables are carried by practically all newspapers in this country, giving due
credit to our organisation. But photos and local news, on the contrary, are generally not credited to Rengo, though a large portion of what appears in the newspapers and magazines in Japan comes from our offices.
We maintain three central news-photo offices—in Tokyo, Osaka and’ Hsinking, Manchoukuo—with scores of competent cameramen to cover every possible angle of important news events. In addition to this, we have relations with a large number of local photographic artists who supply us with “ spot ’’ news-photos.
All these services are readily available for those who care to enter their subscriptions with us.
